review_blob: Meh... not too impressed with this one. Im not sure if its becuase its old or just not that good to begin with. I had high hopes because of this brewers reputation and the fact that its hard to find anything by this brewer in Maryland. Im going back to my 60min IPA for the rest of the night.

A lot of hype surronds this beer that is unobtainable in Maryland. Many people who know very little about craft beer tout this as the very finest. It is decent and well made no doubt, but I dont think it lives up to the hype. I took a vacation to Hatteras Island, N.C., and was surprised at the selection of available craft beers on the island. I got this bomber at the genral store in Hatteras village. Decent, subtle, mild, easy drinking. Personally, Id go for a Stone Pale Ale every time before this one.
This beer is DELICIOUS! A very distinct caramel malt aroma and taste. Very different from Celebrator, and very, very good. I am craving this beer.
I enjoyed virtually everything about this beer. I wish it was available year round. This is an underrated, tasty beer.
Abundantly malty and not bad at all. Caramel malt, spice/fig, and dark fruits. Decent beer that is better than the novelty it conveys.
Im really diggin STs efforts lately. They are really making some delicious experiments! This is another success IMO. Interesting contrast of the dark, roasted malts with powerful hops.
Bottle. Pours hazy dark golden/yellow. Earthy hops, biscuity malt. Low carbo, slightly slick. Taste is very good. Good Pils.

Impressively tart and funky. This is a first from Victory...at least that Im aware of. Well done too. I enjoyed this beer and will drink again. I didnt really make the HopDevil connection. This is an entirely different beer, but good nonetheless.

Outstanding beer that was surprisingly tart and slightly funky. The 15.5% was so well hidden I would have thought it was 8% easily. I waited as long as I could to open this beer and was glad I did, but it could have easily cellered longer. I highly recommend this beer for something unique and special.
mild, earthy, astringent. not much malt presence. subdued, but not very well balanced. this is a fantastic concept because it shows the individual qualities of the hops.

Love the concept. A unique and simple way to explore the different characteristics of some of the widely used hops. The beer is solid. Pours hazy orange with a ginormous frothy off-white head that took its time settling. Pretty straight forward IPA. Grapefruit, dandelion and some malt. Nothing major.

This is another huge success from ST! I wasnt sure what to expect. The only other beer that Ive had that could possibly compare to this one is DFH Burton Baton. This one is much different, and dare I say better....hmmmm. Its cleaner than the Burton...not as sticky or cloying. The oak stands out very well and it all comes together for a very unique brew. Well Done!
This beer wasnt bad, but it was pretty forgettable. Nothing really stood out. The oak was not very evident. Id like to try it again, perhaps with the series 1
This is an amazing impy stout. Absolutely loaded with intense, creamy chocolate flavors. ST definitely nailed this one!
This is a great American representation of the style....light, smooth, malty. I recommend this one.

Bottle. Thanks Luke.. Pours hazy yellow with thin white head. Aroma is apricots and biscuits. Thin, watery mouthfeel. This one didnt do it for me, although I like the organic concept. I suspect that we will begin to see a significant increase in the quality, and quantity, of organic beers in the near future.
Bottle. Thanks Luke!  Pours stout black with tan head. Aroma of hops, roasted malt, dark fruits. Nice mouthfeel. Seems like a pretty decent representation of this style.
Shared a bottle of this with my mom. I enjoyed this one much more than the port harvest ale. The three words that came to mind were: sharp, woody, and boozy.

A tasty beer that is low in ABV but packs a pleasing flavor and palate. Bottle. Pours light amber/golden with a decent frothy head. Aroma is biscuity with light floral hop notes. A very light and balanced flavor. Not bad at all. Im curious about this style now and would like to find the best available bitters. It seems that so many beers imported from Britain look like they are only a novelty beer with their silly names and labels...hard to distinguish.

On tap at Arundel Mills. First, I would like to say that it should be a prerequisite for servers to have some knowledge about beer if they are going to work at a freakin brewpub. Our server was clueless. Anyways, this beer was decent. The best quality of this beer was how well the alcohol was hidden. Not particularly flavorful or aromatic, but not offensive. It was served ice cold and I didnt have the patience to wait for it to warm up to properly evaluate it.  Next time Ill order a pint of Venom and a glass of this stuff at the same time and drink the Venom first while this warms up.

Drank straight from the bottle so I will have to re-reate at some point. I will say that it was enjoyable. Malty taste and smooth finish. Ive said before that Im biased towards Clipper City because they are local, but this is a solid effort worth trying.
beer_name: Heavy Seas Small Craft Warning ber Pils

review_blob: 04 Bottle. Shared with a frined on New Years Eve 2008. Pours cloudy brown with heavy sediment. This was my first experience with this unusual and complex beer. I must say that it was not what I expected. Loaded with an assortment of flavors and aromas that are uncommon in most beers, this one takes some getting used to. Where to start....Heavy carbonation. Malty, fruity and slightly funky. Another rater mentioned fruitcake and I agree. I would also add leather and perhaps a slight note of musty funk. Very interesting. Now that I know, I would not dare open for at least ten more years.

Bottle. 2007.Shared with a friend on New Years Eve 2008. Pours deep amber with heavy sediment. Powerfull aroma of port and oak. Sweet, vinous taste with malt and some sugar too. A very interesting beer that I would love to cellar and try after a few more years.

On tap at Frisco Grill in Columbia, Md. Served in 10oz. dimpled tulip. Everything about this beer seemed moderate. Aroma was of grapefruit with some subtle maltiness. The flavor was somewhat predictable, enjoyable and balanced. This was my first experience from Legacy Brewing.

Bottle. Pours Hazy orange with a thick off-white head. Excellent lacing. Huge citrus hops aroma. Very well balanced by a huge addition of malt(s). Good example of the style. Nice and bitter, but nothing like the Ruination. Overall: very good.

Bottle. Pours an orange amber with a fluffy off white head. Big citrus hop aroma with some caramel malts in the background. Big hop taste, pretty well balanced. Bitter. 10% is very well hidden. Overall a solid effort.
beer_name: Middle Ages X Double India Pale Ale

review_blob: Bottle. Pours deep red/amber and golden. Nice fluffy head. A deliciously sweet honey and hoppy aroma. Taste is different for a DIPA. Sweet but not cloying. Very well balanced. Theres a ton of malt in here. A succulent brew. I highly recomend it!
Bottle. 06 Vintage. Pours brown with amber highlights. Creamy head. Strong, raisin and malt aroma. Smooth, creamy texture. Still pretty hoppy. Another winner from a great brewery!
Bottle. Amber brown with small, off white head. Caramel, dark fruits, brown sugar, and hops in the aroma. This was a great beer and reminded me why I love barley wines.
Bottle. Pours deep amber with minimal head. Average lacing. Piney hop aroma. Spicey hop flavor with some malt sweetness. Lots of carb. Good beer. Nice session ale.

Bottle. A really luscious beer that is surprisingly good. MuttyD nailed the deScription on this one! I have seen this beer on the shelves so many times but for some reason have never tried it until now. It is now my favorite brew from Ommegang.
Bottle. An excellent East Coast DIPA from Southern Tier. This is a balanced big beer with a hell of a lot of hops. This is a great classic example of the style.

06 bottle. Pours clear dark amber with a tight, compact off white head. This is like a concentrated beer...very thick, somewhat syrupy. Reminds me of a DFH 120min and Raison Dextra  a little bit. I really cant explain the aromas going on. It just seems like there is an overabundance of everything with a generous helping of alcohol. Not your everyday drinking kind of beer. Its a good sipper once it warms up.

On tap at Faegans in Syracuse. Deep black with thick tan head. Looks like a Guinness, but tastes better. Typical stout qualities but with an emphasis on chocolate and berries/fruit. Not overly roasted or dry. Decent beer.

Bottle. Pours deep amber with thin off white head. Big malty aroma followed by piney hops and berries. Tasty. Kind of slick. Not very bitter, at least not for an IPA or Red ale or whatever the hell this is. Get a bit of grapefruit in the flavor though. Very decent beer. Worth trying.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: Bottle. Pours dark, murky brown with thin off white head. Aroma is wheat, clove, malt and butter. Soft palate that is creamy. Delicious flavor. The wheat seems to present a somewhat subdued forefront followed by a decent bitterness in the finish. Very good beer.

Bomber. Pours clear golden with thin white head. Strong grass and pine hop aroma. Initial impression was good, but not what I expected. I have not had the little brother of this beer hop sun. I dont get much of the wheat aroma or flavors. I think that it cuts that bitterness on the finish though. This just seems like a pretty hoppy brew that is easy drinking and not too bitter. It has a nice earthy & sweet component to it that kind of reminds me of a mead. Interesting.

Bottle. Not as bad as I was expecting, but was by no means impressed. I poured in a glass and drank with some baked ziti. Pretty standard pale lager. The one thing that I liked was that it was not too fruity or sweet.

03 Bottle. Thanks Dave! Interesting beer to say the least. Would not have guesed it as a Belgian impy....tasted more like a strong ale. Pours nut brown with heavy chunks and a decent light brown head. Big toffee aroma! Distinct Belgian yeast aroma and taste. Warming, but not hot.

06 Bottle. This one blew me away! Opaque black with thin brown head. A very complex and sweet aroma and taste. It did not exhibit the typical impy qualities of roast, choc., coffee etc... very different. There were hints of rice wine, rum-raisin, and fish oil. Sweet malt and gentle hops were present as well.  WOW!  Id love to try this one after about 10 years in the cellar.

Bottle. Pours black with dark brown head. Aroma is roasty and smokey. I found this beer to be a bit one dimensional and a bit thin/watery. I drank this after I had an expedition stout and it just seemed like a much less substantial beer. Its good,but I wasnt impressed.

Bottle. Thanks Dave! Pours a beautiful dark brown/black with a reddish dark brown head. Aroma is somewhat sweet with roasted barley, dark fruits, molasses, choolate. Warming. Sweet, hoppy and full bodied. This beer is very well balanced. No one flavor dominates, they all compliment each other. Definately the most balanced impy stout that I have had so far.

Bottle. Im not aware of any craft brewers making pale lagers. I have no illusions about this beer though. I expect it to suck. I just dont fucking trust macro brewers, because who knows what shit they put in here to make it sparkle, appear crystal clear or impart a certain natural taste chemically. Why is it that the shittier a beer is the more they spout off about quality and tradition? Theres nothing really offensive about this beer though. Other than the fact that it, like all other macros, is an absolute insult to real quality beer and nothing more than the product of dispassionate and uninspired greed. HEINEKEN CAN SUCK IT! "Heinekant" "Heineken: Its all about the $"

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Tap @ Faegans. Not too cloudy... kind of clear even. Spicy not very much wheat in the flavor or aroma. Not very good at all. Never been a fan of Magic Hat beers, and this one is no exception.
Tap  @Faegans, Hazy, murky yellow. Big banana and bubblegum aroma. Medium body, and banana taste. Nice wheat aftertaste. Solid!
Tap @ Faegans. Pours copper brown with small off white head. Cereal grain and malt in the aroma with some SN pale ale type hops as well. Citrus and bitter finish. Decent session ale.

Tap @ Faegans. Served in small tulip glass. Looks plum with pinkish 1 finger head. Bright fruity aroma of rasberry sherbert. Tart and quenching. Taste is nothing like any beer that Ive ever had. I would have guessed some kind of Bartles and James wine cooler or something.

Bottle. BB Aug 08. Pours deep, dark amber with a thin khaki head. Great malty and sligtly earthy aroma. Solid medium body with moderate carbonation. Taste is sweet and malty with a bit of hops but a lasting malty finish. Clean. Put a Stone or Great Divide label on here and watch the rating scores jump!

Bottle. Thanks Dave (dchmela) No idea how old. When I popped the cap the cork released itself with a ferocity. Tons of foam at first, but it died down to manageable levels. I never would have guessed that this was a Belgian Saison if you just gave it to me in a glass. It tastes like a Belgian ale. Pours deep blood orange with a massive head. The aroma is quite unique. It seems that it is built around the malt with some fruits (oranges, dates, grapes. and apples after I burped.) and spices. There really isnt any funkiness present. Its definitely not champagne like and it doesnt smell light or refreshing. It does smell and taste  good though. Not what I expected.

750ml.Bottle. Label has the picture of the dude drinking in a chair. Dont know how old this bottle is, but im guessing its pretty young. Pours slightly hazy pale gold/straw with thin fizzy head. Settles to a clear pale gold. Aroma: Light barnyard funk, leather, must, oak, grapeskin. Nice. Flavor is sharp, tart and funky. Dry finish and a bit harsh. Too young?? Ok. What a fantastic style of beer.
